definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)
to turn out in force ready to attack (idiom)

sentences.english: We hide behind the bush, ready to pounce on the intruder.
sentences.chinese: 我們藏在灌木叢後面，準備向來犯者發起突然襲擊。

sentences.english: We hid himself behind the  bushes, ready to pounce on the intruder.
sentences.chinese: 我們藏在灌木叢後，準備向來犯者發起突然襲擊。

sentences.english: We are determined to wipe out any enemy who dares invasion.
sentences.chinese: 我們決心消滅任何膽敢來犯之敵。

sentences.english: Troops are on the alert against any possible aggression.
sentences.chinese: 軍隊戒備着可能的來犯。

sentences.english: We are ready at all times to wipe out any enemy who dares to come.
sentences.chinese: 我們隨時準備消滅一切敢於來犯之敵。

sentences.english: The bikes are better spent economy harassing and driving your enemies force away from your base.
sentences.chinese: 摩托應該用於騷擾經濟和將來犯之敵趕出你的基地。

sentences.english: If our enemy dare to attack us, we'll punish them severely and crush them into pieces.
sentences.chinese: 敵人膽敢來犯，我們一定嚴懲不貸，打它個粉身碎骨。

sentences.english: In modern times Turkey guarded NATO's southern flank against Soviet mischief.
sentences.chinese: 現代以來，土耳其守衛着北約南翼，防備蘇聯來犯。
